Description: Glazed composition figure of a standing woman, head and feet missing, arms by sides, with back pillar, but no perforation ? Glaze lost, originally creamy off white, with small porosities, with black-brown glaze on bracelets, in circles on breasts and in neat triangular shape on pubic area. Core -creamy, hard, fine texture. Modelling finer than standard group, with well-rounded breasts, nipples indicated by incised circle, and fingers and one thumb shown on hands.
Curator's comments: This figure does not belong with the other products of the factory which was producing male flute players etc. It may be later in date. The modelling is better, and different from those products, and the even, hard texture of the faience is also of a different quality.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OM.23)
